member.summary: Gets the active categories from the cache. If they aren't in the cache, queries the database and puts the result in the cache.

member.summary: Gets the entries for the specified month.

member.name: M:Subtext.Common.Data.Cacher.GetSingleEntry(System.String,Subtext.Framework.CacheDuration)
member.summary: Retrieves a single entry from the cache by the entry name. If it is not in the cache, gets it from the database and inserts it into the cache.

member.name: M:Subtext.Common.Data.Cacher.GetSingleEntry(System.Int32,Subtext.Framework.CacheDuration)
member.summary: Retrieves a single entry from the cache by the id. If it is not in the cache, gets it from the database and inserts it into the cache.

member.summary: Returns true if the regex matches the specified URL.

member.name: P:Subtext.Common.UrlManager.HttpHandler.PageLocation

summary.p: Gets or sets the page location. This is the location of the page used when the handler type is .
The format for the page location should be a path relative to the ApplicationPath (no beginning slash).

member.example: If Subtext is installed in a virtual directory name "Subtext.Web" and the virtual path to the page is "/Subtext.Web/SomeDirectory/MyPage.aspx", the PageLocation should be "SomeDirectory/MyPage.aspx".

summary.p: Gets or sets the actual directory location. This is the location of the directory used to find the actual file when the handler type is .
The format for the directory location should be a path relative to the ApplicationPath (no beginning slash).

example.p: If Subtext is installed in a virtual directory name "Subtext.Web" and the virtual path to the directory is "/Subtext.Web/Admin/", the PageLocation should be "Admin".
Thus requests for http://host/Subtext.Web/MyBlog/Admin/SomePage.aspx will be handled by http://host/Subtext.Web/Admin/SomePage.aspx

member.name: P:Subtext.Common.UrlManager.HttpHandler.FullPageLocation
member.summary: Gets the full physical path to the page specified by .

member.name: T:Subtext.Common.UrlManager.PageHandlerFactory
member.summary: System.Web.UI.PageHandlerFactory is internal. We need the option to load our own classes with this for the virtual mapping. With the virtual mapping default documents will not be loaded. if no page is found, we will use attempt to load default.aspx in the current directory

member.name: T:Subtext.Common.UrlManager.UrlReWriteHandlerFactory
member.summary: Class responisble for figuring out which Subtext page to load. By default will load an array of Subtext.UrlManager.HttpHandlder from the blog.config file. This contains a list of Regex patterns to match the current request to. It also allows caching of the Regex's and Types.

member.name: M:Subtext.Common.UrlManager.UrlReWriteHandlerFactory.GetHandler(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Implementation of IHttpHandlerFactory. By default, it will load an array of s from the blog.config. This can be changed, by overrideing the GetHttpHandlers(HttpContext context) method.
member.param: Request Type (Passed along to other IHttpHandlerFactory's)
The current requested url. (Passed along to other IHttpHandlerFactory's)
The physical path of the current request. Is not guaranteed to exist (Passed along to other IHttpHandlerFactory's)
member.returns: Returns an Instance of IHttpHandler either by loading an instance of IHttpHandler or by returning an other IHttpHandlerFactory.GetHandlder(HttpContext context, string requestType, string url, string path) method

member.name: M:Subtext.Common.UrlManager.UrlReWriteHandlerFactory.ReleaseHandler(System.Web.IHttpHandler)
member.summary: Releases the handler.
